result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Zoom appearances.
Preliminary held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charge contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Offer deadline:  09-09-22
Settlement conference with the District Attorney set for 10-19-22 at 9:45 a.m.
Minutes.
Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-03-22 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

1:56 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric P. Birr not in court.  Attorney Dennis Melowski appearing by zoom for defendant.  Attorney Melowski was not aware that this new complaint had been filed.  Requests adjournment.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

RE:  OWI (2nd)-causing injury, on 06-13-21.
